uiDefinition.description: Name of the storage account the connector should use.
uiDefinition.tooltip: Provide the storage account name

uiDefinition.description: Specify a valid primary/secondary storage account access key.
uiDefinition.tooltip: Specify a valid primary/secondary storage account access key.

generalInformation.description: Microsoft Azure Storage provides a massively scalable, durable, and highly available storage for data on the cloud, and serves as the data storage solution for modern applications. Connect to File Storage to perform various operations such as create, update, get and delete on files in your Azure Storage account.

uiDefinition.description: The name of your storage account
uiDefinition.tooltip: Provide the name of the storage account used for tables as it appears in the Azure portal

uiDefinition.description: The shared storage key of your storage account
uiDefinition.tooltip: Provide a shared storage key for the storage account used for tables as it appears in the Azure portal

generalInformation.description: Azure Table storage is a service that stores structured NoSQL data in the cloud, providing a key/attribute store with a schemaless design. Sign into your Storage account to create, update, and query tables and more.

uiDefinition.description: Azure Event Hubs Connection String
uiDefinition.tooltip: Provide Azure Event Hubs Connection String

generalInformation.description: Connect to Azure Event Hubs to send and receive events.

uiDefinition.description: The host name and port the MQ server is running on (host:port).
uiDefinition.tooltip: Server:Port

uiDefinition.description: The name of the Queue Manager to connect to.
uiDefinition.tooltip: Queue Manager name

uiDefinition.description: The channel to connect to the Queue Manager on.
uiDefinition.tooltip: Channel name

uiDefinition.description: The name of the default queue, may be overriden.
uiDefinition.tooltip: Default queue name

uiDefinition.description: The user name to use when connecting to MQ.
uiDefinition.tooltip: Connect As

uiDefinition.description: Authentication type to connect to your Queue Manager
uiDefinition.tooltip: Authentication type to connect to your Queue Manager

uiDefinition.description: Username credential
uiDefinition.tooltip: Username credential

uiDefinition.description: Password credential
uiDefinition.tooltip: Password credential

uiDefinition.description: Enable SSL? (True/False)
uiDefinition.tooltip: Specify if SSL needs to be enabled

generalInformation.description: Microsoft Connector for MQ integrates Azure applications with resources stored in an IBM WebSphere MQ server. Supports message send and receive operations.

uiDefinition.description: The SAP client ID to connect to the SAP system.
uiDefinition.tooltip: The SAP backend's client (or 'Mandant') into which to log in. It is a number ranging from 000 to 999.

uiDefinition.description: Authentication type to connect to the SAP System. Must be basic (username and password).
uiDefinition.tooltip: Authentication type to connect to the SAP System.

uiDefinition.description: The username to be used for log in to the SAP System.
uiDefinition.tooltip: The username to be used for log in to the SAP System.

uiDefinition.description: The password to be used for log in to the SAP System.
uiDefinition.tooltip: The password to be used for log in to the SAP System.

uiDefinition.description: Application Server Logon (Type A)
Group Logon (Type B aka Message Server)
The type of logon to the SAP System, either Application Server Logon (Type A) or Group Logon (Type B aka Message Server).
uiDefinition.tooltip: The type of logon to the SAP System.

uiDefinition.description: The hostname of the SAP Application Server.
uiDefinition.tooltip: The hostname of the specific SAP Application Server to connect to.

uiDefinition.description: The service name or port number of the SAP Application Server.
uiDefinition.tooltip: The service name or port numbe of the specific SAP Application Server to connect to (Optional for connection type (Logon) A - Application Server).

uiDefinition.description: The SAP System’s System Number. It is a number ranging from 00 to 99.
uiDefinition.tooltip: The SAP System’s System Number. It is a number ranging from 00 to 99 (Mandatory if connection type (Logon) is A - Application Server).

uiDefinition.description: The hostname of the SAP Message Server aka R3 System Name.
uiDefinition.tooltip: The hostname of the SAP System’s Message Server (central instance) aka R3 System Name (Mandatory if connection type (Logon) is B - Message Server (Group)).

uiDefinition.displayName: MS Service Name or Port Number
uiDefinition.description: The service name or port number of the Message Server.
uiDefinition.tooltip: The Service Name (as defined in etc/services) or the Port Number under which the Message Server is listening for load-balancing requests (Mandatory if connection type (Logon) is B - Message Server (Group) and System ID is not present)

uiDefinition.description: The System ID of the SAP system.
uiDefinition.tooltip: The SAP system’s three-letter system ID (Mandatory if connection type (Logon) is B - Message Server (Group) and Message Server Service is not present)

uiDefinition.description: The Logon Group for the SAP System.
uiDefinition.tooltip: The Logon Group for the SAP System, from which the Message Server shall select an Application Server (Only available if connection type (Logon) is B - Message Server (Group))

uiDefinition.description: Use strong types if false, otherwise use string as safe type.
uiDefinition.tooltip: Enables safe typing, which treats types as string instead of strong types (e.g. Date, Time, Datetime), relaxing type and value validations.

uiDefinition.description: When selected, the connections will be secured with SNC.
uiDefinition.tooltip: When selected, the connections will be secured with SNC

uiDefinition.description: Name or path of the SNC library to be used.
uiDefinition.tooltip: Name or path of the SNC library to be used. Path can be absolute path or relative to the NCo library

uiDefinition.description: The SNC SSO specifies whether to use SNC identity or credentials provided on RFC level.
uiDefinition.tooltip: The SNC SSO specifies whether to use SNC identity or credentials provided on RFC level.

allowedValues.text: Logon with the username/password information provided on RFC level

uiDefinition.description: Identity to be used for this particular destination/server (optional).
uiDefinition.tooltip: The installed SNC solution usually knows its own SNC name. Only for solutions supporting 'multiple identities', you may need to specify the identity to be used for this particular destination/server (optional)

uiDefinition.description: The backend's SNC name (Required when Logon Type is Application Server).
uiDefinition.tooltip: The backend's SNC name (Required when Logon Type is Application Server)

uiDefinition.description: Quality of Service to be used for SNC communication of this particular destination/server.
uiDefinition.tooltip: Quality of Service to be used for SNC communication of this particular destination/server

packageContentLink.description: Upload package containing SAP NCo components and optionally SNC components.

generalInformation.description: SAP connector is part of Microsoft’s hybrid integration platform. Use this connector to run SAP based applications side by side with Logic Apps to connect with On-Premise Line of Business systems.

uiDefinition.description: Azure Service Bus Connection String
uiDefinition.tooltip: Provide Azure Service Bus Connection String

generalInformation.description: Connect to Azure Service Bus to send and receive messages. You can perform actions such as send to queue, send to topic, receive from queue, receive from subscription, etc.

uiDefinition.description: Integration Account ID
uiDefinition.tooltip: Provide Resource ID for the integration account

uiDefinition.description: Integration Account SAS URL
uiDefinition.tooltip: Provide SAS URL for the integration account

uiDefinition.description: The name of the host running a TN 3270 server.
uiDefinition.tooltip: Server

uiDefinition.description: Specifies the port for the TN 3270 server.
uiDefinition.tooltip: Specifies the port for the TN 3270 server

uiDefinition.description: The 3270 model to use.
uiDefinition.tooltip: Device Type

uiDefinition.description: Specifies the code page of the host.
uiDefinition.tooltip: Code Page

uiDefinition.description: The name of specific logical unit to request from the TN 3270 server.
uiDefinition.tooltip: Logical Unit Name

uiDefinition.description: Enable SSL? (True/False)
uiDefinition.tooltip: Specify if SSL needs to be enabled

uiDefinition.description: Validate host ssl certificate? (True/False)
uiDefinition.tooltip: Specify if host ssl certificate should be validated

generalInformation.description: Microsoft Connector for 3270 integrates Azure applications with resources available via TN 3270 Screen Scraping.
